article:
'Clemens' is both a Late Latin masculine given name and a surname meaning
"merciful". Notable people with the name include:

'Surname:'
* Andrew Clemens (b. 1852 or 1857â1894), American folk artist
* Barry Clemens (born 1943), American basketball player
* Brian Clemens (born 1931), British screenwriter and television producer
* Clayton Clemens, American Professor of Government
* Dan Clemens (born 1945), American politician
* George T. Clemens (1902â1992), American cinematographer
* Harold W. Clemens (1918â1998), American politician
* Isaac Clemens (1815â1880), Canadian farmer and politician
* Jacob Clemens non Papa (c. 1510 to 1515â1555 or 1556), Franco-Flemish composer
  of the Renaissance
* James Clemens, Lord Mayor of Liverpool 1775-6
* James Clemens, pen name of author James Paul Czajkowski
* James Clemens, Jr. (1791â1878), a US Senator
* Jean Clemens (1880â1909), youngest daughter of Samuel Langhorne Clemens
  (Mark Twain)
* Jeremiah Clemens (1814â1865), U.S. senator and novelist
* Josef Clemens (born 1947), German bishop
* Joseph Clemens (1862â1936), American missionary and plant collector
* Joseph Clemens of Bavaria (1671â1723), German archbishop
* Kellen Clemens (born 1983), American football player
* Koby Clemens (born 1986), American baseball player
* Marcus Arrecinus Clemens (disambiguation), multiple people
* Martin Clemens, British World War II soldier and Solomon Islands coastwatcher
* Mary Strong Clemens (1873â1968), American botanist and plant collector
* Olivia Langdon Clemens (1845â1904), wife of Samuel Langhorne Clemens
  (Mark Twain)
* Orion Clemens (1825â1987), brother of Samuel Langhorne Clemens (Mark Twain)
* Roger Clemens (born 1962), American baseball player
* Samuel Langhorne Clemens, better known as Mark Twain (1835â1910), author
* Sherrard Clemens (1820â1881), American politician and lawyer
* Titus Flavius Clemens (consul), great-nephew of the Roman Emperor Vespasian
  and (as Flavius Clemens) a saint in the Greek Orthodox Church (Clement of
  Alexandria)
* William Clemens (film director) (1905â1980), American film director

'Given name:'
* Clemens (entertainer), (born 1979), real name Clemens Legolas Telling, Danish
  rapper, singer, music writer, actor
* Clemens (impostor) (d. c. 15 AD), ancient Roman
* Clemens Arnold (born 1978), German field hockey player
* Clemens Baeumker (1853â1924), German historian of philosophy
* Clemens Bollen (born 1948), German politician
* Clemens Brentano (1778â1842), German poet and novelist
* Clemens Denhardt (1852â1929), German explorer of Africa
* Clemens Fritz (born 1980), German footballer
* Arno Clemens Gaebelein (1861â1945), Methodist minister
* Clemens Maria Hofbauer (1751â1820), patron saint of Vienna
* Clemens Holzmeister (1886â1983), Austrian architect
* Clemens Kalischer (born 1921), German-American photographer
* Clemens Klotz (1886â1969), German architect
* Clemens Krauss (1893â1954), Austrian conductor
* Clemens August Graf von Galen (1878â1946), German count, Bishop of MÃ¼nster,
  and Cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church
* Clemens von Pirquet (1874â1929), Austrian scientist and pediatrician
* Prince Clemens Wenceslaus of Saxony (1739â1812), German Archbishop
* Clemens Westerhof (born 1940), Dutch football manager
* Clemens Wilmenrod (1906â1967), German television cook
* Clemens Winkler (1838â1904), German chemist

'Fictional characters:'
* [[List of characters in the Alien series#Jonathon Clemens|Dr. Jonathon
  Clemens]], a character in the 1992 film Alien 3 played by the British Actor
  Charles Dance
* See Cambridge Latin Course for Clemens, a fictional slave
